edu.ncsu.csc216.collections

Class LinkedListRecursive.ListNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.collections.LinkedListRecursive.ListNode
  • Enclosing class:
    LinkedListRecursive<E>

    private class LinkedListRecursive.ListNode
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a node for the list to store data and a pointer to the next node in the list
    Author:
    JeffColeman, GeneTodd, SamuelJessee

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      E data
      The data stored in the node
      LinkedListRecursive.ListNode next
      The next node in the list

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ListNode(E data)
      Constructs the ListNode with only data being based in and a null next)
      ListNode(E data, LinkedListRecursive.ListNode next)
      Constructs a ListNode with the passed in data and a pointer for the next node in the list

      • ListNode

        public ListNode(E data,
                LinkedListRecursive.ListNode next)
        Constructs a ListNode with the passed in data and a pointer for the next node in the list
        Parameters:
        data - the data put in the node
        next - the next node in the list

    • Method Detail

      • remove

        public E remove(int i)
        Removes a node from the list based on its index. Uses recursion to get to the spot just before the index. Then it sets the data to a temporary field for returning and changes next to the node following the next node (next.next).
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the node to remove
        Returns:
        temp the data removed from the list

      • get

        public E get(int i)
        Method used to get the data at a specific index.
        Parameters:
        i - index where the data is stored
        Returns:
        data the data of the node at the index

      • add

        public void add(int i,
                E element)
        Method used to add an element at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of where the element is to be added in the list
        element - the element to add to the list

      • add

        private void add(E element)
        Method used to add an element to the end of the list. When there is no next node, a new node with the element as its data is created and size is incremented appropriately
        Parameters:
        element - the element to add to the list

      • set

        private E set(int i,
              E element)
        Sets the data at the index to the element and returns the data that was overwritten
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the list to set the new element to
        element - the element to put in the node
        Returns:
        temp the data that was in the node before it was changed to element
